parameters: This allows you to save your game. Be sure to do this from time
to time to keep your progress!
you'll have to find a \C[4]save point\C[0]!
You can this menu to load a save file without having to return to the title screen.
Have questions on how specific game or battle mechanics work? This guide contains information about
the various parameters, status effects, and combat mechanics in the game!

parameters: Returns you to the title menu. Progress will not be saved so make sure to save first!
\C[4]Hit Points\C[0] \I[20] or \C[4]HP\C[0] represent a character's health or vitality in combat.
If a character's health hits \C[18]0\C[0] then that character is rendered unconscious!
or \C[4]SP\C[0] represents a character's ability to use spirit energy
to perform battle arts or cast spells. Most skills will use this so if they run out they'll be stuck
\C[4]Exceed Points\C[0] \I[28] or \C[4]EX\C[0] represents a character's ability to unleash powerful
Exceed Arts. You will gain 1 EX when the Exceed gauge is filled and you can store
up to 3 points. Some Exceed Arts only cost 1 point while others can cost up to 3!
\C[4]Attack\C[0] \I[22] is a character's ability to deal damage with basic attacks
and most battle arts, though there are some exceptions.
\C[4]Defense\C[0] \I[23] is a character's ability to reduce damage from physical damage.
\C[4]Spirit\C[0] \I[24] is a character's ability to deal damage with spells. Occasionally
battle arts will utilize this as well.
\C[4]Resistance\C[0] \I[25] is a character's ability to reduce damage from elemental attacks.
\C[4]Focus\C[0] \I[26] represents a character's ability to land accurate strikes to vital points. It primarly affects
\C[4]critial damage\C[0] \I[30] though it also gives a small bonus to \C[4]critical rate\C[0] \I[29]
and EX gained when using skills.
\C[4]Agility\C[0] \I[27] represents a character's ability to move and act quickly in battle.
This affects turn order and characters with high agility
will get several more turns over slower opponents
There are 8 elements in the world of Astoraia, all of which, except Physical, are associated with
the gods known as the Elementals. Though not always the case, they are
\C[4]KO\C[0] \I[1] indicates that a character is unconscious and can no longer fight. Don't worry about the scary looking symbol, they
can recover with certain spells and items.
\C[4]Poison\C[0] \I[2] will reduce HP by 1/3 of the user's Spirit per turn.
\C[4]Burn\C[0] \I[3] will reduce HP by 1/4 of the user's Spirit per turn and increase damage taken by 10%.
\C[4]Bleed\C[0] \I[14] will reduce HP by 1/3 of the user's Attack per turn.
\C[4]Confusion\C[0] \I[5] will make the afflicted strike allies and foes alike at random.
\C[4]Seal\C[0] \I[7] prevents the afflicted from using arts, spells, or overdrives.
\C[4]Stun\C[0] \I[6] prevents the afflicted from taking action for a turn, and they cannot dodge.
Hitting the target may break the stun.
\C[4]Sleep\C[0] \I[8] prevents the afflicted from taking action for longer than stun, but getting hit will wake them up. The afflicted also cannot dodge.
\C[4]Shock\C[0] \I[9] prevents the afflicted from generating AP and lowers damage by 10%.
\C[4]Chill\C[0] \I[10] halves the afflicted's agility and prevents the afflicted from dodging.
\C[4]Buffs\C[0] \I[34] are described with a parameter icon and one or two up arrows.
Most buffs can be stacked up to two times, and the number of arrows indicate the stack level of the
buff. The levels correspond to a +10% and a +20% increase, respectively.
\C[4]Debuffs\C[0] \I[51] are described with a parameter icon and one or two down arrows.
Most debuffs can be stacked up to two times, and the number of arrows indicate the stack level of the debuff.
The levels correspond to a -10% and -20% decrease, respectively.
Critical rate \I[12] and evasion \I[82] buffs are the primary exceptions.
They only have one level and are additive +10% increases.
\C[4]Barriers\C[0] \I[208] absorb a set amount of damage then break.
Its remaining health is indicated on the icon.
Different regeneration effects will stack by adding additional turns,
but only \C[18]one\C[0] barrier effect can be active on a character.
Combat uses a \C[4]Charge Turn Battle (CTB)\C[0] system.
Battles are taken in turns, but battles are not broken up into rounds where each battler gets one turn per round.
Instead, a battler's speed is used to compute whose turn will finish charging next.
turn is currently active and an estimate of who the next few turns will be.
Battlers with higher \C[4]agility\C[0] \I[27] will have turns more often than slower battlers.
Some skills, especially intermediate and advanced spells, have cast times. Using them will cause the user
to enter a casting state and they will execute the skill when their turn comes again.
Modifiers to agility can also affect turn order so plan carefully but be flexible!
\C[4]Ability Points (AP)\C[0] are used to learn new skills.
You can find new skills by going to "Skills" in the main
menu, and then going to the "Learn" submenu.
Not all skills are available at the beginning of the game.
As you unlock skills, new skills will be revealed. Some skills have
multiple skills as pre-requisites. Learn as many
skills as you can to find new combinations!
